DataElement.preferredName: Patient Cancer Diagnosis ICD-O-3 Behavior Code Carcinoma In Situ Malignant Remission Eligibility Determination Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The Yes/No response that indicates the patient meet eligibility requirement for participation in a clinical trial with regarding cancer diagnosis with an ICD-O histologic behavior code of two "2" (carcinoma in situ) or three "3" (malignant).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Cancer Diagnosis ICD-O-3 Behavior Code Carcinoma In Situ Malignant Remission Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures._General term for detecting and classifying cancer in patients._The code for the behavior of the tumor being reported using ICD-O-3._A malignant epithelial neoplasm confined to the epithelial layer and without evidence of further tissue invasion._Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host. (NCI)_A decrease in or disappearance of signs and symptoms of cancer.  In partial remission, some, but not all, signs and symptoms of cancer have disappeared.  In complete remission, all signs and symptoms of cancer have disappeared, although there still may be cancer in the body._The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Concepts.definition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Property.preferredName: Cancer Diagnosis ICD-O-3 Behavior Code Carcinoma In Situ Malignant Remission Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: General term for detecting and classifying cancer in patients.:The code for the behavior of the tumor being reported using ICD-O-3.:A malignant epithelial neoplasm which is confined to the epithelial layer without evidence of further tissue invasion.:Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host.:An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease).:The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

Concepts.definition: General term for detecting and classifying cancer in patients.
The code for the behavior of the tumor being reported using ICD-O-3.
A malignant epithelial neoplasm which is confined to the epithelial layer without evidence of further tissue invasion.
Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host.
An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease).
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
